1112.content:
Which of these characters might we follow?

Adam Reynolds (pic)   - An IT professional by trade, you're more used to sitting in front of a Linux terminal than fighting for your life, but that doesn't mean you can't handle yourself in a pinch. You're about 5'10", dark-haired and reasonably fit, with a short beard growing from your rigid jawline. On your way out of the office building that fateful evening, you smiled at the greying night guard, who tipped his hat politely as you passed by. Out on the streets, walking back to your apartment, you had no idea what horrors awaited you.

Kayla Harrison (pic)   - Every office has one: the quintessential babe that all the guys and even some of the girls fawn over. At the small marketing firm you'd started at last Summer, it quickly became apparent that you would be filling that role. Curvy, blonde, and just a little plump in all the right places, you spent half of your time giggling at your coworkers' clumsy attempts to flirt with you. You were headed out for an iced caffè latte on your lunch break when the undead calamity began.

As she neared the doors to the Havana Breeze Café, her attention was drawn to a toppled planter by the entrance. Her gaze rose, and peering into the little shop, her pulse took an uptick. The place looked to have been looted. Chairs and tables had been shoved carelessly aside, and a layer of discarded debris littered the floor. (Pic)

111221311.content:
"Everything alright, sweetie?" Jenny asked from behind the counter.

"Yeah...it's just....felt like someone walked over my grave."

Jenny smiled, And without addressing Kayla's cryptic answer, disappeared through the double doors leading to the kitchen.

Kayla didn't notice her go. She was too busy staring out the front window. Something had happened out there, in front of the cafe. She didn't know how she knew that, but she did. Call it intuition, revelation, it was all the same.

"Latte, Miss."

"Huh...?"

"I said your latte's ready," the waiter named Ted said. He stood proffering the cup to her,

"Ahh, sorry. Daydreaming, I guess." She took the cup and looked upward, flashing an appreciative smile...

...which soon withered and died as she took in the grotesque figure that stood before her. Tattered waiter's uniform showing ribs pressing through rotting flesh, a face brown and weathered, stretched too tight, with no lips, empty eye sockets staring. The stench of dead meat filled Kayla's nostrils and she had to fight the urge to puke.

"Are you okay," came the death-distorted voice of Corpse-Ted.

Kayla blinked and when she opened her eyes, she saw Ted. Regular Ted. Not dead Ted, looking at her with genuine concern.

"Yeah," Kayla said cautiously, "long day at the office. I thought I saw...never mind. You know what, I changed my mind about the latte. Here," She fished through her purse, pulled out the first bill she grabbed, a twenty, and thrust it at Ted. As soon as he plucked the bill from her hand, Kayla slid from the booth and nearly ran through the door out into the street.

Everything seemed loud, the honking of cars, the chattering of passerby. Even the sound of the Autumnal wind, blowing scattered leaves down the sidewalk proved too much for her senses and she swayed like a drunkard, fell to her hands and knees. Panting, she looked around her at the city, but it was dead now, no people. Rusted cars lined the streets. shattered windows, And the living dead, roaming freely through the streets, shambling, moaning. Then the vision shifted and she saw her. Not her her, but another her. An alternate Kayla that looked and dressed exactly the same. She was flanked by two zombie who Kayla recognized as Ted and Jenny. Kayla, the real Kayla, unable to push the vision from her head, watched in horror as the two dead cafe employees approached her hapless doppleganger, one ripping Kayla's shirt and bra off, the other grabbing her skirt. Kayla watched in horror as her other self was raped, molested, and eventually devoured by the undead fiends. And once finished, they stood, their decaying bodies tensing. They spun with more agility than one could imagine and spotted Kayla, still on her hands and knees. They moved then, in lock step, half shambling, half sprinting, eyeing their next victim.

Kayla screamed as the two zombies grabbed at her clothes, but before she could fall victim to the same fate as her other self, the vision ended. Kayla was lying on her back in the middle of the sidewalk. She struggled to her feet and looked around, relieved to find everything was normal. No zombies, no deserted city. Everything was as it should be. Well, almost everything. A little ways off, about where her other self had met her demise in Kayla's crazy waking nightmare, was a large fissure that split the sidewalk. A strange red glow radiated out from the crack, calling to her, beckoning her closer.

What does Kayla do?
